text:
Hi all,
How can I determine which page type a page is. I found out `{{ content.CMSContentType }}` that return a ‘BLOG_POST’ or ‘STANDARD_PAGE’ but I need this for for the system pages like ‘404, 500, preference pages’. I know there is the ‘templateType’ but I can’t get this value. Any ideas?

Is there a property of a repeating field that will give me the number of repeated items?
e.g. `module.some_field.count`
the  `length`  filter will give you the count of items in an array.
Hi HubL’ers, I am trying to pull the metadata for notes associated to a deal but the “crm_associations” function doesn’t seem to return it. Do i need to pass in another parameter to get that?

<@U22PWJ41G>
is there a way to access nonce from header or how to implement nonce for inline script.
will nonce be auto generated or how would I generate and use nonce
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/domains-and-urls/ssl-and-domain-security-in-HubSpot>
Thanks,

I would do something like this…
`{% set results = crm_property_definition("p4829685_safety_documents", "document_type") %}`
`{% for option in results.options %}`
`{% if option.label == 'Joint Loss Management Committee Minutes' %}`
`{# option.label should contain what you need #}`
`{% endif %}`

Is there a way to access a custom property from the deal object in the design manager of the custom quotes : {{ personalization_token(‘template_data.quote.address_des_travaux’,‘’) }} This does not give me the property..
